review: This is the most delicious I have never been disappontied. I wish that they would add turkey burgers but I am ok with that .i love the umlimitied fries

It's a smaller space than I've seen at other RRs, but there seemed to be plenty of staff to keep things moving. The food was prompt and very fresh. One of our burgers was crazy salty, but the other was delicious. I was very excited the kids meals have bottomless sides as well! There will be a long wait at this place for a while, I'd wait a bit or try an off peak  time to visit.

Opening night. Staff was energetic and friendly. Food was good and served in a timely manner. Prices seemed fair and included bottomless drinks and fries. We ordered nachos as an hors d'oeuvre which was enough to feed a party of 4.  Atmosphere was lively with large tvs and music; we could hold conversation without shouting. I would only change the avocado smear on sandwiches to freshly sliced avocados.

Went to RR for the first time tonight and it was really good.  The service was fantastic, the food was really good, and super fast.  Everyone we very friendly and the mood of the whole place was fun and upbeat.  Loved the onion ring tower and the burgers were great.  Will definitely go back, there was a line when we left!
First time eating at Red Robin and definitely want to go back. Staff was very friendly, food was great and not a long wait for it to be served.

Love Red Robin, this location is different. Food was great, staff was great, but tables are so packed in it's ridiculous. Much different from other RR's in the area. Tables so close the servers had to turn sideways to squeeze through, lifting trays of food over our heads as well as the bus boys lifting dish carriers over our heads. Not cool Red Robin, whoever designed this new layout gets an F. Very hard to get to rest rooms having to negotiate high chairs, big pocketbooks hanging on chairs and walkers. Tables so close I got all the details of my neighboring tables medical procedures whether I wanted to hear them or not. I really felt sorry for the servers. Not cool when they are trying to deliver food to a neighboring table and their butt is in your face. Only a 10 minute wait, wasn't as crowded as we thought it would be but plenty of patrons for the size of the dining rooms. Will go back but will ask for a booth next time, seems like the safest spot.

Our visit today was a little disappointing. First, the hostess wouldn't let us sit at a 4 top table, wanting to "reserve" it for a larger party should one come in. That would have been fine if it hadn't been half empty in there. In fact for the first hour that we were there no one sat there at all. Then the hostess sat another couple there after that hour had passed. In the meantime we were placed at a small 2 top table that we barely fit into. In all fairness though,  our server was absolutely great and we loved her. Then our food came. I ordered the fruit for my side. It was awful. The condition that it was in would be the point I would throw it away if it were in my fridge. Complete mush. Everything else was just ok.

For stars is possibly generous and hopeful for future visits. We were there Memorial Day Sunday about a week after opening. The seating areas are small with lots of tables. We were early for dinner and waited about 15 minutes. They didn't make it clear to us but they text when your table is ready. It seemed like they called out some names, but not ours. I happened to look and saw I had received a text that they were ready. Weird when we were standing right there!  The food was great as usual. They have that down. Servers were very friendly and attentive. The kids' food came out quickly, which we did appreciate. Husband and I waited a good 20 minutes more for ours. We were checked on several times and didn't feel neglected in any way, but it was a long time to wait. We'll be back for sure, maybe a weekday lunch for a second try.

Location is small. Service is slow. Constantly had to ask for refills, napkins, etc. Root Beer was flat. Burgers were a step up from fast good, certainly not "gourmet." I have enjoyed other Red Robins, but this one missed the mark. Make this a last resort.

Servers seemed inexperienced and confused, very slow to perform basic tasks such as clear dishes from the table to make space or bring napkins etc...food wasn't up to par with the other red robins I've visited but wasn't terrible...once they slowed down they seemed to deliver a little better customer service....not an awful experience but not a good one either
Too small and crowded, exasperated by the slow wait staff. Better burgers across the street at Five Guys.

location is much smaller than other RRs in Wake county. Wait staff even had a hard time navigating the space. Service was very slow with a party of 2..can't imagine a large group. Very uncomfortable dining experience at 3 pm on Saturday. Hate to see the place during busy time. On the plus side the food was good.

Swing and a miss.  Small, loud, horrible acoustics.  Server was a very awkward fellow.  Our appetizer came out quickly but it took FOREVER to get our burgers.  Manager finally came out and said that there was a problem with our order and he was going to comp our appetizer and go make our burgers personally.  Good customer service in that respect but it should not take 40 minutes to make 2 burgers and onion rings, especially at 3:00 PM on a weekday.  Food was not as good as we have had at other Red Robin locations.

The restaurant is way too small. When being seated had to wait for server to serve food to a table as we couldn't get past her in the tight space. Very slow service. Would never try to eat there on a weekend again.

Only reason I didn't give this RR's Garner location a five is the place is tiny! Why? Anywoo, the food is absolutely wonderful. My favorite place for a gourmet burger. The garlic aoili and sweet chili sauce is so great on burgers and fries. It is just great food and I have had great service. This is my new burger place close to Garner/Raleigh.

Restaurant was very dirty. Hostess was not pleasant (at all). We ate our food, paid, took the little one to the restroom and ALL of our dirty plates were still on the table. They were not busy. Food was good but we will not go back.

What a great place for a super burger! We've been here THREE times this week! Each of the staff was knowledgeable, good at their job and super friendly! Yep, you bet we'll be back! Sarah, manager came by to introduce herself. Nice touch!

First time at this location. There were both bad and good.  The bad: Like others had said, the restaurant has a small footprint.  We were lucky enough to get a booth, but I'm pretty sure if we were placed in an inner table, we would've gotten claustrophobic to the point of panic.   But the good outweighed:  The staff were friendly and prepared.  The food was good.  Our drinks were kept full and we were offered extra fries without having to ask. On that last note.  Eating out for my family can be a little bit of a challenge.  My wife is a vegetarian and my daughters are vegans, both by choice and because of allergies.  Our waitress, Victoria, handled our special orders efficiently and cheerfully.  (And the back line had it all right!)  Then when offering extra fries, Victoria did remember the need for a basket to not have the seasoning on it.  This is a first of the many times we've been to RR through the years. We will be back.

The food was good, but the burger is not half puns like they advertise. This place just opened and they obviously have some thing to work out and fix. Very cramped inside, service was slow, and they sit you at seats where the sun shines in your eye. Need to get some blinds.

I waited 24 hrs to calm down to write this so here it goes. First walking in we were seated and our waitress came promptly. Asked about our drinks. My mom and I both wanted something w a kick so we told her we weren't ready. She goes well I can get you soda or water or ice tea. None did we really want, but figuring she needed something to do. So we said water. She comes back puts them down ask if we were ready for our drink order ect. This process repeated every 2 mins. We felt hounded. We finally (after sharing a drink menu) decided what we wanted and placed that order. After that it's what do you want to eat, this started a 2 min return to table. Ugggg finally w a very large selection being our first time here decided. Placed our order I said "NO pink I'd rather them burn it then it be pink." It comes back the food runner brings out silverware and napkins since we had NONE at this point. ( she actually noticed and just did this wo asking I was impressed by her!) I cut my burger at first it looked fine after a few bites there was pink lots of pink to me. I called our waitress over she says " I can take that half ( the half I hadn't touched) and have them put it on the grill for you will that be ok or do you want a manager." Ummmm manger please. Manger came over took my plate and rung up another burger for me came back perfect and was very good. We finished our meal ordered desert to go which the brownie stick things are amazing btw. However walking out I was notified I was charged for both burgers yep both and they can remove it from my card but would be a 3-5 days.  So to me the food was good was it worth the price no not really my burger was 14$ ( each lol) and I just don't see the hype for that.  My drink was watered down and my moms was over kill they are not measuring the liquor correctly for the mixes.  The brownie sticks are worth the price and worth the Calories lol amazing these little things lol.  Service was way below expectations Waffle House waiters can out do our waiter any day. For what is suppose to be a slightly upper class environment I expected better. Bar and wait staff could take lessons at TGI Fridays. As for the management staff by the point you realize that A my order wasn't cooked rt, my new order came out when my mom was done eating AND I was over charged sorry but by that point to me both burgers should of come off my tab not just the one that was messed up. It's all little things yes but it ruined my first visit and I can say our next girls day when we are like umm where should we go, red robin won't be on the list! Very disappointed!  Gave two stars Bc the food once rt did Taste good
Great burger, fries were a bit soggy but that's expected since we got takeout. The shake was not very good, probably best to skip it. Next time we will dine in and try a beer with our burger.

Today I went to Red Robin in Garner, NC and it was one of the worst experiences I have had at any restaurant. To begin with our server Rhonda asked for our drink orders and did not return with them for 10 minutes.  Upon returning someone in my party asked her a simple question about the mac-and-cheese sides and she responded by yelling at him.  After our food was ordered the waitress did not return to the table for about 5 minutes and she brought the sides of fries.  We did not see her again for at least 20 minutes to check up on us. After another 20 minutes our food came out.  When we began inspecting out food to make sure it was what we ordered, my friend found his order to be incorrect. He asked her to take it back and get the cooks to remake the food.  She returned very quickly with the same burger on a different bun with the condiments just wiped off. He asked to see a manager and we did not see her for around 10 minutes. After speaking to the manager and getting the order processed correctly the food that was incorrect was left at the table.  Once the correct meal was brought back to the table it was fine. However this was one of the worst experiences I have had at a restaurant. The waitress was very inconsistent in managing our table, the manager was not very friendly, and the quality of the service was just lacking in general. This is not somewhere I would like to eat at again.

6 dollars for a small craft beer and burgers were 15. Atmosphere was noisy and well for lack of a better word bright. Not comfortable and certainly not welcoming. Very cramped. I'll stick to Logans Road House - better price point, value and atmosphere. Even our server was in agreement about the pricing in regards to beverages. Do not foresee a return visit
Waitress was good. Food mediocre. Hi priced for what u get. Chicken tortilla was runny. Chicken and shrimp was small for $13. Burgers are good.

WOW, what a dissapointment,  wait staff was slow, food was luke warm at best.  I was really excited as I always enjoyed Red Robin.  This time was different.  I have had better burgers in a high school cafeteria.  Burger had NO texture, bacon was sliced so thin and was so tough I had too check to make sure I was not eating a plastic wrapper,  I could taste the gas from the grill as well.  Waitress upsold the loyalty program for the birthday burger, however you cannot redeem that for 24 hours.  I guess I will be cancelling that membership.  I don't blame the restaurant as much as Red Robin as a whole.  It seems like they have changed the burger patties to a processed piece of pink slime like you see on the expose shows.  I really used to enjoy Red Robin, but if this is the new burger formula, I would rather have a Hardee's, Burger King, and if I want to splurge....5 guys.

Let me preface this with we generally visit the Cary, NC location and WE LOVE IT THERE!  Never any issues.  Very inviting.  Always hot, fresh food.  However, our experience with the the Garner location on Friday was AWFUL!  The restaurant was 1/4 full.  The only thing that came out in a timely manner was our shakes/sodas/water.  Waiter was great but experience was AWFUL.  We waited over an hour for 3 burgers.    Other customers were in after us and out before us.  Manager could care less.  No explanation.  No apology.  Barely wanted to address any customer service issues with the kitchen.  And too bad we brought it to his attention.  Both my daughter and I were sick after we ate there - she ended up in the ER the next day.  Maybe we should have kept our mouths closed.  Literally!

First time ever eating at a Red Robbin.  We had heard good things about the restaurant and went to the Garner location beside Cabela's.  When we walked in the hostess wanted to seat us at the bar, we said we wanted the dining room and they looked confused and several minutes later we were seated in a booth.  The waitress came over gave us our silverware and left.  She came back later and took our drink order we had to have time to look at the menu.  The drinks did come quickly but I also ordered a glass of water and it was not brought I had to remind the waitress.  When they took our order I ordered my burger Pink according to the menu.  It took over 30 minutes for our food to come out it was just me and my wife and we both ordered burgers in a burger joint.  The waitress finally came by and I needed a refill on my water. She brought the water and said she would check on us in 2 minutes.  My burger was well done and my fries were cold.  We had to hit the alert button on the Kiosk because we never saw the waitress again.  After I finished eating she came by and I told her about my burger.  The manager later came by and did comp my burger.  I told him about the waitress and length of time to get our meal.  I never saw the waitress again had to pay using the Kiosk.  I will never eat there again hope this is not a reflection on all Red Robbin Restaurants.

Small location, but it wasn't a busy time so we were seated right away.  Service was great, and all the food arrived correct even with requested modifications to the menu items.  Great family atmosphere.  Will definitely visit again.
Burger joint, i don't see what everyone else is raving about. I would not go out of my way to eat there.

Business was rather crowded today....thus the service was rather mediocre...The waitresses seemed overwhelmed and not very attentive to their clients today. However management did circulate quite often and seemed truly and genuinely interested in how your dining experience went....The food is good, as it was the first time; however, sitting is a bit too close...as often, people sitting at the tables beside you joined in your conversations. Will I come back? Probably, just not in a Friday night.
The burgers are large, dry (mine was anyway), and pricy. I'd give the place a third star if they didn't charge $14.00 for a "gourmet" Black & Bleu burger.
Friendly staff, food is not bad for a chain Restaurant. Don't you dare come on a Friday or Saturday night unless you like to wait.

Very slow service, even on a not so busy Monday night. Also never known of a restaurant to be out of Spinach & Artichoke Dip.  Party of 2.... been here almost 40 minutes and still haven't received our order of burgers and fries. Not very pleased. This is my second time at this location and honestly hesitant to ever try it again. Added 1 star because the burger tastes good. It's sad to see that in the top 7 results of the Red Robin's in our area that none of them have over 3 stars.

The wait was absolutely ridiculous.  A hour for a burger?!? Understaffed? Poor management? I shouldn't have to wait for over 10 minutes for a refill? None the less, it was not busy. I have not waited this long at any other local resturantes.. might have to consider other locations

This visit saw me returning with my lady. Ordered a Keep It Simple cheeseburger and bottomless fries.  She ordered the same thing. My first visit wasn't too impressive for the price and I figured it was due to the rush of people eating after getting frozen in line waiting to place their ballot.  But this visit made up for it.  The burgers were made to order and tasty.  The fries were crispy and about as perfect as you could ask for.  Refills on drinks and fries were timely.   Not sure if I was really hungry or the burger was smaller than I would have wanted because I finished it in what seemed like seconds.  My lady hadn't even had a 1/4 of hers yet.  Eek. Server was extremely friendly, almost too friendly, and upon inquiry (which I am oft to do due to a lack of shame) I found out she was extremely tired so she was trying to make up for it.  Once she felt at ease things were good until the end. This place is a bit pricey for the prices but you almost get what you pay for.  The decor and the bottomless fries are a bonus. Make sure and sign up for their rewards program.  I am constantly getting emails regarding BOGO1/2O or for other free things.  Might be worth you taking the time.

This is a really cute Red Robin, It does get busy in here, One night we went and it was going to be an hour wait, so plan accordingly. The Southern Charm burger is my standard order. I have always had great service here. The location is really good, People in Garner are just nice period I think. Last time we went we had like 20 people at our table, it was very organized and everyone had a great time.

Terrible experience. They were very busy and hostess forgot to save our reservation information on tablet. When we brought it to their attention they did nothing to accommodate us for their mistake. They continued to sit other parties in front of us. After waiting another 10 minutes (original wait of 30) we let the manager know we were leaving and of course....well we can seat you now. We chose to just leave rather than continue with the terrible experience. We will not return.

I was going to write "great place to take a dump" but my gf told me I should write something more mean and detailed. 40 min wait on food. Had 3 different people wait on us. The mac and cheese burger had 7 pieces of pasta on it. Yes I counted. Fries were cold. No silverware, napkins or straws. Had to ask the bus boy for all those things since the waitress disappeared after she left our ticket.  Needless to say 1 star is too high. We never got compensated for this terrible service either.  In summary I take it back you'd prolly have to wait to take a dump here and they'd be out of TP.  ITS A NO FOR ME.

Generally good service, from what I would expect from a newly established Red Robin. Our waiter was cool, lol she had to yell at the kitchen cause they left the onion & tomatoes on my burger but no biggie, I'm not allergic & I can just take them off. My room mates seemed satisfied with their food & they got Sweet potato fries for their sides. I had the wedgie burger & a side of Broccoli for my Keto diet. Food was as good as I expected it to be for Red Robin. May go back again when its convenient.

We are here when it first opened and had a horrible experience. However, we decided some months later to give it another shot, figuring that it was probably just growing pains. We were pleasantly surprised by the improvement in service and food quality. Only complaint is someone was blowing up balloons or doing something that caused a very loud rushing sound (not a blender) the entire time we were eating, and it was distracting and annoying. But the food was great!

I love Red Robin, but the 2 times i've gone, the food has been below par. I was super happy to  know we had a closer location so I didn't have to drive to the Cary or Brier Creek locations, but needless to say I won't be going back.  Both times,we had no wait so no complaints there, but both times food was cold. It was 3 in my party so I understand why my burger was cold.. not even luke warm. 1st time, shame on you, 2nd time, shame on me.. There won't be a 3rd time. Hope you have a better experience. I'll be going back to Cary or Brier Creek.

We love love Red Robin as a franchise / chain, but this can't be a real Red Robin! Seriously folks, the food here is simply horrible. I don't know why or what is going on here. Everything is always cold and the buns for the burgers are always stale. French fries are soggy and also cold. I'm personally a huge fan of french onion soup, but DO NOT get it here. One again cold and they just can't seem to figure out the appropriate amount of broth vs the onions and bread. The only reason I'm giving this Red Robin a 2 star instead of a 1 is because we always try places 3 times before we throw in the towel and the wait staff seemed to improve each time we made a visit, but that's not saying a lot. Red Robin fans, steer clear of this location!

Ate here last week and was surprised at the low reviews. It is a major chain restaurant, so I'm rating it as such. Our waitress was fantastic, super attentive, checked on us just the right amount of time. Overwhelmed with a pretty massive menu, she had our drinks to us within five minutes and got us started with a basket of tasty fries. Both of our burgers arrived quickly, were cooked as ordered, and were quite good. Considering the alternatives in the area, I would say this Red Robin location is one of the better local choices. I have no concern recommending it as a solid burger place with just enough choices of other options, cocktails, beers on tap, sides and delicious looking deserts.

SHORT STORY: I was really impressed with the way Red Robin turned my frown upside down! I was dissatisfied with my milkshake and when I told Brandon about it, he was compassionate and understanding (when I expected excuses and defensiveness). He immediately took steps to make sure it didn't happen again (training opportunity) and FedEx'd me a gift certificate to come try again - to give them a chance to make it right. LONG STORY: It's a silly thing, really. I drove out of my way to go to the Garner Red Robin to get a Salted Carmel Milkshake fix. I had one a week or two prior at a different RR store and couldn't get it out of my head. I took it to go and as soon as I was on the road, I was ready for the first amazing sip of gooey caramel and crunchy salt! Unfortunately, said gooey caramel and crunchy salt never happened. It tasted like a slightly sweetened plain-Jane vanilla milkshake. Boo! I had asked for the bartender to put chocolate sauce on top. I kind of thought it would be chocolate AND caramel...but I didn't specify so I wasn't worried about it. Because I paused to evaluate my topping, I did notice that there was something that looked like a shake of table salt on the top of the whipped cream... so she TRIED...but... it wasn't what I experienced the week prior. While I was waiting for my shake, I heard the bartender talking to another waitress about being sick...maybe getting over it... I don't remember...but I thought "maybe she's not feeling her best, poor thing." Sooooo, I thought to myself, maaaaaaybe that's the reason for the milkshake mishap. I tried to "shake" my feeling of dissatisfaction, but after a couple sips, I realized that I wasn't going to drink the milkshake... I didn't like it at all. I felt resentment bubbling up in me and thought about going back...but then I was on a highway headed in the opposite direction and opted not to turn around. Because I have a long history of appreciation for Red Robin and their many varieties of unique appetizers, sandwiches, and drinks, I decided that it was not a relationship that I wanted to end without at least conversing with them. I called and asked for a manager - Brandon came on the line and, as stated above, was super professional and attentive. He apologized and appreciated that I gave him the opportunity to make it right. (I didn't actually WANT anything - just to let him know - but he made it possible for me to come back and try again.)  Brandon C. single-handedly saved my relationship with Red Robin and I'm forever grateful!

Me and my mother went to this location today and our experience was excellent! Our waitress, Victoria was amazingly sweet and very fast. She was very polite and we even had a nice conversation with her. I tried the mac and cheese cheeseburger and it was delicious! It was a very great experience, and I will love to return soon!
Waitress was good and entertaining. Our Time there was good however food just OK. Double tavern burger was a good though a bit salty.
They definitely have worked out the kinks. Great service, great food and excellent atmosphere. Give them a shot and you won't be disappointed!

Great experience! I stopped in on a Sunday night for dinner and received a quality meal. My burger was cooked a perfect pink (just how I requested it to be). The fries could've had been better. Overall, I have been to different Red Robin locations and this one is by far the best. The customer service was great and the food was fresh. The interior is clean and spacious.  I look forward to supporting this location again in the future.
Went in to eat. Stood at the front for about 8 minutes. Never saw a server, hostess or anything. So I left.

Decided to stop in for a burger, 3:30 pm on Saturday during prime christmas shopping season! Parking lot was empty,  people waiting to be seated, was told it would be 15-20 minutes for a table. What!? There were empty tables everywhere bar was empty, decided maybe we could wait,  went in to the bar area till our table was ready. The lady bartender said we could sit at the tables in there and we had to be seated to sit in there too. Again, place was empty and we just wanted to wait. After that cancelled our wait and left. The bartender was rude. That restaurant is not worth the time. If you cant seat 3 people for a cheeseburger at this time of year you then you should be open in the first place. Went to Five Guys Burgers, got in and out no problems.
For one, who wants to pay $15 for a burger. For two, server with shitty attitude. Best thing was the appetizer.

I had the worst experience of my life at Red Robin today- bad enough that I'm making my first yelp review of all time. I went to RR alone with the plan of meeting up with some friends there in about an hour. I asked the bartender to put on any of the relevant football games (conf championships) and was told that they don't get ABC or FOX. So I had to watch a 2014 replay MLB game. Another server came when the bartender was gone and put on FOX for me, which was great. When the bartender returned, she changed the channel away.   Listen, I know RR isn't a sports bar. But that type of blatant, passive aggressive behavior has no place in the service industry. I frequented that RR several times a month since the opening, but will take my business elsewhere from now on. Good luck making a profit when people figure out just how little you value your customers.
